Episodes.Title: Out of Town
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Cathryn Humphris, Kater Gordon
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Don accidentally learns a secret about Salvatore during a business trip to Baltimore. Back at the office, the firings continue, but the new management appoints Peter and Ken as new co-heads of accounts.

Episodes.Title: Love Among the Ruins
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Cathryn Humphris, Kater Gordon
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Don is brought in to save the day for a P.R. campaign involving the building of the new Madison Square Garden, only to have the rug pulled out from under him. At home, Betty argues with her brother over how to care for their sick ...

Episodes.Title: My Old Kentucky Home
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Dahvi Waller, Kater Gordon
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Roger Sterling throws an expensive party with his new wife, Joan throws a dinner party, Peggy and Paul get stoned while working on an ad campaign, and Don's daughter Sally steals money from her grandpa.

Episodes.Title: The Arrangements
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Andrew Colville, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Don has reservations about a misguided potential client who wants to sell jai alai as the "new national pastime." Meanwhile, Sal produces the "Patio" television commercial, Peggy searches for a roommate, and Betty's father passes ...

Episodes.Title: The Fog
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Betty has hallucinations of her deceased father as she delivers her baby, Peter considers trying to sell the untapped "Negro market" to a reluctant client, and Peggy begins to question her future at Sterling Cooper.

Episodes.Title: Guy Walks Into an Advertising Agency
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Robin Veith, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: The bosses come in from London to reorganize Sterling Cooper, but a key player's career is sidetracked by a freak accident. Meanwhile, as Joan prepares to leave her job, her husband gives her some bad news.

Episodes.Title: Seven Twenty Three
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, André Jacquemetton, Maria Jacquemetton
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: As Don secures an account with Conrad Hilton, Sterling and Cooper try to strong-arm Don into signing a contract. Meanwhile, Betty meets with her acquaintance from the governor's office, and Duck tries to get Peggy to leave Sterlin...

Episodes.Title: Souvenir
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Lisa Albert, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Don and Betty renew their love affair while on a business trip to Rome, while Peter has a bout of infidelity with an au pair in his building while his wife is away.

Episodes.Title: Wee Small Hours
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Dahvi Waller, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: Betty tries to meet with Henry Francis again, while Don steps up his pursuit of his daughter's former teacher. At the office, Don disappoints Conrad Hilton and is forced by a client to fire Salvatore over an unwelcome advance.

Episodes.Title: The Color Blue
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Kater Gordon, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: As Sterling Cooper prepares for its 40th anniversary party, the bosses in London drop a bombshell to Lane. Miss Farrell's troubled brother pays a visit to her and Don, and Betty stumbles onto her husband's secrets.

Episodes.Title: The Gypsy and the Hobo
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Marti Noxon, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: An old flame and potential client reenters Roger Sterling's life, Joan's husband searches for a new job, and Don finally comes clean to Betty about his true identity.

Episodes.Title: The Grown-Ups
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Brett Johnson, Cathryn Humphris
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: On the weekend of the John F. Kennedy assassination, Pete finds out that he lost the promotion to Cosgrove, Roger Sterling's daughter's wedding goes off as planned, and Betty musters up the courage to respond to Don's confessions.

Episodes.Title: Shut the Door. Have a Seat
Episodes.Writer: Matthew Weiner, Erin Levy, Kater Gordon
Episodes.Actors: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser
Episodes.Plot: With another sale on the horizon, Sterling, Cooper, and Draper convince Lane Pryce to fire them and then join them as they start up a new advertising firm. At home, Betty follows through with her plans to divorce Don.
